title: WARN messages appearing after Achieve Sync
body:
Is this a Normal WARN message Once the Node (Archive) has almost finished syncing ?

**Server Info**
```bash
version:
erigon version 2021.12.2-beta

Kernel:
Linux erigon 5.4.0-91-generic #102-Ubuntu SMP Fri Nov 5 16:31:28 UTC 2021 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Distro:
Ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS

Processors:
8 x Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2620 v2 @ 2.10GHz

Ram:
90GB
```

**WARN Msgs Spotted in random order**
```bash
WARN[12-29|17:25:29.457] [RecvMessage] Handling incoming message  error="decode BlockBodiesPacket66: rlp: input list has too many elements for eth.BlockRawBodiesPacket66"

WARN[12-29|17:29:41.043] [txpool.fetch] Handling incoming message msg=TRANSACTIONS_66 err="parse transaction payload: transaction must be either 1 list or 1 string"

WARN[12-29|17:31:08.745] [txpool.fetch] Handling incoming message msg=TRANSACTIONS_66 err="parse transaction payload: envelope Prefix: must be a list"

WARN[12-29|17:35:43.684] [txpool.fetch] Handling incoming message msg=TRANSACTIONS_66 err="parse transaction payload: nonce: uint64 must be a string, not isList"

WARN[12-29|18:21:08.857] [txpool.send] PropagatePooledTxsToPeersList err="sendMessageById to peer be58139e5dac7d7e348ea5c63533cd418e78fdc377893cf85b3d892fc7c48de4: write tcp x.x.x.x:37762->x.x.194.134:30303: write: broken pipe"

WARN[12-29|18:21:08.299] [txpool.send] PropagatePooledTxsToPeersList err="sendMessageById to peer e9xxxxx5690e163b4580bc5b6d72562d85128a64109a300264463e0b7: shutting down"

```
